page.title: 10EDUCATION : BICKER
page.content:
{ EDUCATION : BICKER.}
All school children from Bicker need to travel into the next village of Donington,for Bicker school was closed in 1964 and is now used for storing fertilizers.
When the school closed , children were promised free transport to Donington. About 12 months ago an argument broke out concerning this promise.
A protest march took place but to no avail and parents have to pay to send their children to school. The fare is Â£4.00 per child per term.
The Donington schools are a primary and secondary school.Those pupils who pass the 11+ exam. have to travel into Boston to attend the Grammar school.
